description: Hannah Jones retains the Wales captaincy under new head coach Sean Lynn.
title: Women's Six Nations: Hannah Jones retains Wales captaincy under new coach Sean Lynn
title_page: Women's Six Nations: Hannah Jones retains Wales captaincy under new coach Sean Lynn - BBC Sport
maintext:
Hannah Jones has retained the Wales captaincy under new head coach Sean Lynn.
The 60-cap centre has led Wales since the 2023 Women's Six Nations and will do so again for this year's championship and the Rugby World Cup in England later this year.
Scrum-half Keira Bevan and flanker Alex Callender have been named as vice-captains as Lynn looks to expand his leadership group.
"Being Wales captain is always a privilege and an honour you never take for granted," said Jones, who plays under Lynn at Gloucester-Hartpury.
"I know Sean well. He drives standards on and off the pitch, and is a winner and a great coach."
